snippet: Students and faculty at the university, one of the nation’s pre-eminent historically black higher education institutions, set out Thursday to expand entries and create new ones.
abstract: Students and faculty members at Howard University are rolling out project to fill in gaps of black history on Wikipedia; members of prestigious, historically black university have noted a bias toward the interests of white men in the online encyclopedia, demographic that composes majority of its editors.
lead_paragraph: Students and faculty at the university, one of the nation’s pre-eminent historically black higher education institutions, set out Thursday to expand entries and create new ones.

headline.main: Howard University Fills in Wikipedia’s Gaps in Black History
headline.print_headline: At a Historically Black University, Filling in Wikipedia’s Gaps in Color
